intro: Cirsium rhizocephalum subsp. sinuatum, commonly known as the sinuous thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant features a robust root system and spiny, lobed leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. This subspecies is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
